title: Yannick Bru
text:
Yannick Bru (born 22 May 1973) is a French <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> coach, currently serving as head coach at <a href="Aviron%20Bayonnais">Aviron Bayonnais</a> in the top level of French rugby, the <a href="Top%2014">Top 14</a>. Bru was capped 18 times for the <a href="France%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">French national side</a>.
At Toulouse Bru twice won the <a href="Heineken%20Cup">Heineken Cup</a>, in 2003 when he started, and 2005 as a replacement, as well as winning the Top 14 title in 1999 and 2001. Bru has also been capped 18 times for France, including their grand slam at the <a href="2002%20Six%20Nations%20Championship">2002</a> and <a href="2004%20Six%20Nations%20Championship">2004</a> <a href="Six%20Nations%20Championship">Six Nations Championship</a>, as well as being a part of their <a href="2003%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2003</a> <a href="Rugby%20World%20Cup">World Cup</a> squad.
Bru will left Toulouse at the end of the 2011–12 season to join the staff of the French national team as forwards coach.
